step.context: \text{If }\left(7 -6x + x^2\right) = \left(a^2 - t^2\right)\text{,where a is}\\ \text{constant, then what are a=? and t=? }
step.reason: \text{Notice that }-\left(x + 3\right)^2 = -\left(x^2 +6x + 9\right) \\ = -x^2 -6x -9.\text{Quite close to }-x^2 - 6x + 7\\ \text{In fact, }-x^2- 6x +7 - 16 = -\left(x + 3\right)^2\\ \Rightarrow -x^2-6X +7 =16 -\left(x + 3\right)^2 = 4^2 - \left(x + 3\right)^2\\ \therefore a =4 \text{ and }t = \left(x +3\right).
